Multiple trace theory incorporates the Indexing Theory (IT) to a broader model, which also extends into remote memory consolidation. The MTT postulates that the hippocampal formation is the first to encode the initial information upon learning, in a sparse and distributed manner, and that, similarly as in the IT, this hippocampal ensemble acts as an index to link the cortical neurons that are also representing the incoming information.
